title: Darius and Fiora gain their ultimate bonuses even when denied by Zilean's R.
body:
[ Noxian might's buff and {{champion:114}} 's AoE heal still trigger through Zilean's ultimate ]

Is this intended? Or can we get a fix? The target is not dead.

I wonder if the bug applies to  effect and clones like {{champion:62}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:35}}.

But seriously, please fix this.

{{champion:26}}

replies.body: technically you do die. You just revive.

> [{quoted}](name=sreggad,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=0nlmn2Il,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-12T06:20:50.667+0000)
>
> technically you do die. You just revive.

If that's your argument, fine. At least be consistent with it.

Let it grant resets to {{champion:121}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:55}} etc because the target does die. Don't half ass the coding and have it extremely confusing like what damage goes through {{champion:24}} E and what doesn't.

Zilean consistently denies resets and "on kill" mechanics, {{champion:114}} proccing 1 vital then killing and {{champion:122}} dunking are the only exceptions which were recently introduced in rapid succession, which is why I figured it wasn't intentional.

There is a reason why those deaths do not count on the scoreboard, supposedly time reversal prior to loss of life.

this edit makes your original comment make so sense. get rekt you ignorant toxic fuck
Fiora's heal field also triggers on a GA. I noticed this earlier today actually.
It is intended, the ults complete on "lethal" damage.
Also, if you ult a clone (Shaco, Wukong, LB) and proc at least one vital before the clone dies, you get the heal.
Happens when Zac has his passive up too. :/

Fiora's ult goes through as long as she either a) The Target perishes, and Fiora has hit one Vital, OR b) She hits all 4 vitals

I'm assuming it's intended 'cuz technically the target ***does*** die, it just revives. xD

Darius doesn't even need to kill anyone for Noxian's Might to proc?? As long as the target has all 5 bleed stacks, he goes into Noxian Might lol

Noxian Might is his passive, which happens when an enemy champion gets 5 stacks of bleed OR dies to his ultimate.

His ultimate also can be recast if it kills someone, which it does, the enemy just revives.

Yeah, I know. I typed it out weirdly 'cuz I'm tired as shit, but basically, I was just trying to say that the reasoning for both abilities is the same, i.e.:

There's scenario a) where the target doesn't even need to die to apply the AoE Heal/Noxian Might (all 4 vitals/all 5 bleed stacks), and b) where it procs when the target dies. 

Because the procs are consistent with each other, and in most cases where resurrection occurs (Zil's revive being the example in particular here), it's safe to assume that this is functioning as intended (or to the extent that spaghetti code allows, anyhow)

Idk who downvoted me but it sure as hell wasn't warranted xP
Considering it also goes through GA, it seems to be intended.

Idk, I feel like both those ults should work that way. They are both high risk and require execution to function, so if the target just gets zilean'd, it would feel pretty crumby to have the ult negated.I mean, all that damage you did is ALREADY negated.
This is intended. At least for Fiora.
